segments.text: I notice the woman is so focused on drying that plate, like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She hasn’t even noticed the water overflowing from the sink, creating a puddle around her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think it’s kind of funny how she’s just standing there, completely unaware of the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being so sneaky, trying to get cookies from the jar without her knowing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is standing on a stool that looks like it’s about to tip over, but he’s determined to get those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the girl is just standing there, waiting for her share, like it’s the most natural thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is just so chaotic, but everyone seems so calm and collected.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I should say something, but I’m just enjoying the moment, watching it all unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water keeps pouring over the edge of the sink, and it’s spreading across the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long it will take for the woman to notice the mess, but for now, she’s completely absorbed in her task.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far, and it looks really dangerous, but he seems to know what he’s doing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope he doesn’t fall, but I can’t help but smile at his determination.
segments.speaker: PAR
